clues.text: He was nominated for a Best Actor Oscar for "The Stunt Man"
He was Speaker of the House from 1977 to 1987
In 1934 this writer had an "Appointment in Samarra"
Bestsellers by this political satirist include "Parliament of Whores" & "Give War a Chance"
This Irish playwright wrote "Juno and the Paycock" for the Abbey Theatre in Dublin
The name Nabisco comes from abbreviating the National this Company
This type of butterhead lettuce is also called limestone
It's a person who loves or collects books
The first peacetime atomic weapons test was conducted here on July 1, 1946
The name of this ball game comes from the French for "sticks"
A 1985 Nobel Prize went to "Intl. Physicians for the Prevention of" this potentially devastating type of conflict
BINGO is business-oriented NGO; ENGO stands for this type, like the Sierra Club
Based in Illinois, this league with a Spanish name is trying to get mothers to put down that bottle
Orbis International says 28 million people stricken by this don't need to be
The NGO now called this began with people of a British college town trying to feed WWII Greece
In 1989, aboard Discovery, Frederick D. Gregory became the first black commander of one of these missions
For his role in "Lilies of the Field", he was the first African-American to win a Best Actor Oscar
"On My Honor" from 1975 to 1978 Gloria Randle Scott served as the first black president of this organization
Robert Weaver, the first black Cabinet member, made himself at "home" in this department in 1966
In 1950 this U.N. mediator became the first African-American to win the Nobel Peace Prize
This word, which we sometimes use for TV, is Brit speak for the subway
In England, it covers a car's engine; in America, it cover's a baby's head
To do some repairs around your house, you might hire a sparky, one of these people
The British don't normally eat these with gravy; they're cookies
Common term for a doctor's office; it's where he "operates" from

rounds.comments: (Alex: You have to tell us the identity of the person.)

clues.text: His "Top Ten Rejected Batman Villains" included "The Ticketmaster", "Lactose Intolerant Man" & "Incontinento"

rounds.text: It's the only Canadian province that is separated from the North American mainland
